text: The Book of Samuel the Seer is a lost text. ==Description== A description within , in the conclusion to the first Book of Chronicles, reads: "Now the acts of David the king, first and last, behold, they are written in the book of Samuel the seer, and in the book of Nathan the prophet, and in the book of Gad the seer." ==Commentary== Samuel, Nathan and Gad were the three prophets who had appeared within 1 Chronicles during the account of David's reign.Mathys, H. P., 1 and 2 Chronicles in Barton, J. and Muddiman, J. (2001), The Oxford Bible Commentary, p. 283 == See also == * Table of books of Judeo- Christian Scripture * Non-canonical books referenced in the Bible * Lost work * Samuel ==References== Category:Lost Jewish texts Category:Samuel
title: Book of Samuel the Seer
